action.action-desc: Ms. Clarke of New York (for herself, Mr. Cartwright, Ms. Schakowsky, Ms. DeGette, Ms. Barragán, Mr. Smith of Washington, Mr. Lynch, Mr. Khanna, Ms. Bonamici, Mr. Beyer, Mr. Sherman, Ms. Norton, Mrs. Napolitano, Mr. Cohen, Mr. DeSaulnier, Ms. Tlaib, Ms. Velázquez, Mr. Huffman, Mr. Espaillat, and Mr. Morelle) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend the Clean Air Act to eliminate the exemption for aggregation of emissions from oil and gas sources, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Closing Loopholes for Oil and other Sources of Emissions Act or the CLOSE Act.

section.header: Repeal of exemption for aggregation of emissions from oil and gas sources
section.text: Section 112(n) of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. 7412(n)) is amended by striking paragraph (4).

section.header: Hydrogen sulfide as a hazardous air pollutant
section.text: The Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency shall—

paragraph.text: not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, issue a final rule adding hydrogen sulfide to the list of hazardous air pollutants under section 112(b) of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. 7412(b)); and

not later than 365 days after a final rule under paragraph (1) is issued, revise the list under section 112(c) of such Act (42 U.S.C. 7412(c)) to include categories and subcategories of major sources and area sources of hydrogen sulfide, including oil and gas wells.
